target_markets.market_description: Entrepreneurs and business professionals seeking to identify and validate new business opportunities

problems_validated.problem: People waste valuable time on business ideas that turn out to be fads
problems_validated.severity: High - affects reputational and financial risk
problems_validated.market_gap: Lack of structured process to avoid confirmation bias and echo chambers

business_strategies.strategy: Counter-puncher approach to business research - actively seeking counterpoints to avoid confirmation bias
business_strategies.implementation: Research both supporting evidence and opposing viewpoints for every hypothesis
business_strategies.expected_results: Reduced risk of investing in fads, better reputational protection

problems_solutions.problem: How to systematically research new business opportunities without falling into confirmation bias
problems_solutions.solution: Multi-platform research approach with deliberate counterpoint investigation

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Getting caught in echo chambers during research
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Making poor investment decisions based on biased information
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Actively seek counterpoints and opposing viewpoints to every hypothesis
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Researching NFT counterarguments like 'right click and save' and environmental concerns

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Not making mental commitment before starting research
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Wasting valuable time on half-hearted investigation
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Start with clear mental commitment to thoroughly investigate the opportunity
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Gary's approach of deciding 'I'm doing this' before beginning research
